      • extractFirstTxIdAfterPosition

        protected AbstractLogTailScanner.ExtractedTransactionRecord extractFirstTxIdAfterPosition​(LogPosition initialPosition,
                                                                                          long maxLogVersion)
                                                                                   throws IOException
        Extracts txId from first commit entry, when starting reading at the given position. If no commit entry found in the version, the reader will continue into next version(s) up till maxLogVersion until finding one.
        Parameters:
        initialPosition - LogPosition to start scan from.
        maxLogVersion - max log version to scan.
        Returns:
        value object that contains first transaction id of closes commit entry to initialPosition, or NO_TRANSACTION_ID if not found. And failure flag that will be set to true if there was some exception during transaction log processing.
        Throws:
        IOException - on channel close I/O error.

      • getTailInformation

        public LogTailInformation getTailInformation()
                                      throws UnderlyingStorageException
        Collects information about the tail of the transaction log, i.e. last checkpoint, last entry etc. Since this is an expensive task we do it once and reuse the result. This method is thus lazy and the first one calling it will take the hit.

        This is only intended to be used during startup. If you need to track the state of the tail, that can be done more efficiently at runtime, and this method should then only be used to restore said state.

        Returns:
        snapshot of the state of the transaction logs tail at startup.
        Throws:
        UnderlyingStorageException - if any errors occurs while parsing the transaction logs

      • dumpBufferToString
